thought: The website is accessible, now I need to extract the text from the HTML to check for any suspicious content.
observation: RIT Capital Partners plc |  Skip to main content Search form Search Home About us Investment approach Our Board Our Investment Manager (JRCM) Our history Buy RIT Shares Shareholder information RIT in the news Reports Financial performance Factsheets Detailed share price Historical performance Regulatory disclosures Annual General Meeting Company announcements Regulatory announcements Financial calendar Email alerts Contact us Delivering exceptional long-term performance £10,000 invested in RIT at inception would be worth ~£351,000¹ today² compared to the same amount invested in the ACWI³ which would be worth ~£123,000. Latest News: RIT publishes March NAV and commentary RIT Capital Partners plc is an investment trust whose objective is to deliver long-term capital growth, while preserving shareholders’ capital. Since listing on the London Stock Exchange in 1988, we have generated a share price total return of 10.6% per annum for our shareholders. Read more > RIT: Investing in RIT is easy with a UK online stockbroker such as Hargreaves Lansdown. Click here to buy RIT shares now RIT shares are also appropriate for IFAs to market to their retail investors Our reports Annual Report December 2023 Half Yearly Report to June 2023 Our manager, J. Rothschild Capital Management Limited (JRCM), combines investment expertise with access to high quality deal flow.  The essence of JRCM’s investment approach is to combine capital preservation with capital growth over the long term. Since 1988, RIT has delivered outstanding performance for its shareholders. Over the last ten years, a RIT shareholder has seen a NAV per share total return of 109%¹. A shareholder who invested in RIT at inception will have seen a share price total return of 10.6% per annum. Find out more Based in historic Spencer House, RIT traces its origins back to 1971 when Jacob Rothschild was appointed chairman of a £5 million Investment Trust. Today RIT has net assets of over £3.5 billion². ¹ With dividends reinvested. The RIT Capital Partners plc website is for information purposes only and nothing contained in this website constitutes investment advice.  Past performance is not necessarily a guide to future returns.  The value of investments can fall or rise and you may not get back the amount invested. thought: I can see that the website is for an investment trust, and it doesn't seem to exhibit any of the characteristics of a scam website. It provides information about the company, its history, investment approach, and performance. There are no unusually low prices, claims of free money, or targeting of psychological weaknesses. The contact information also seems appropriate for a business. Based on this analysis, I can determine if it is a scam website or not. {

observation.reason: The website does not exhibit any characteristics of a scam website. It provides legitimate information about an investment trust including its history investment approach and performance.
